Package laazotea.indi.driver

Provides the classes necessary to create INDI Drivers, their Properties and Elements to which the INDI Clients may connect.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    INDIConnectionHandler
    An interface for those drivers that wish to have a standard CONNECTION property.
    INDIElementAndValue
    A interface representing a pair of a INDIElement and a value for the Element.
    INDINotLoadableDriver
    An interface representing a NOT Loadable Driver in the INDI Protocol.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    INDIBLOBElement
    A class representing a INDI BLOB Element.
    INDIBLOBElementAndValue
    A class representing a pair of a INDIBLOBElement and a INDIBLOBValue.
    INDIBLOBProperty
    A class representing a INDI BLOB Property.
    INDIDriver
    A class representing a Driver in the INDI Protocol.
    INDIDriverRunner
    A class to initialize and launch a INDIDriver.
    INDIElement
    A class representing a INDI Element.
    INDIFilterWheelDriver
    A class representing a Filter Wheel Driver in the INDI Protocol.
    INDIFocuserDriver
    A class representing a Focuser Driver in the INDI Protocol.
    INDILightElement
    A class representing a INDI Light Element.
    INDILightProperty
    A class representing a INDI Light Property.
    INDINumberElement
    A class representing a INDI Number Element.
    INDINumberElementAndValue
    A class representing a pair of a INDINumberElement and a Double.
    INDINumberProperty
    A class representing a INDI Number Property.
    INDIOneElementBLOBProperty
    A class representing a INDI BLOB Property with only one BLOB Element (with the same name and label of the Property).
    INDIOneElementLightProperty
    A class representing a INDI Light Property with only one Light Element (with the same name and label of the Property).
    INDIOneElementNumberProperty
    A class representing a INDI Number Property with only one Number Element (with the same name and label of the Property).
    INDIOneElementTextProperty
    A class representing a INDI Text Property with only one Text Element (with the same name and label of the Property).
    INDIPortProperty
    A class representing a the standard INDI PORT Property.
    INDIProperty
    A class representing a INDI Property.
    INDISwitchElement
    A class representing a INDI Switch Element.
    INDISwitchElementAndValue
    A class representing a pair of a INDISwitchElement and a SwitchStatus.
    INDISwitchOneOfManyProperty
    A class representing a INDI One Of Many Switch Property.
    INDISwitchOneOrNoneProperty
    A class representing a INDI One or None Switch Property (aka a simple button).
    INDISwitchProperty
    A class representing a INDI Switch Property.
    INDITextElement
    A class representing a INDI Text Element.
    INDITextElementAndValue
    A class representing a pair of a INDITextElement and a String.
    INDITextProperty
    A class representing a INDI Text Property.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    INDIValueException
    A class representing an exception on the value of a INDIElement.

Package laazotea.indi.driver Description

Provides the classes necessary to create INDI Drivers, their Properties and Elements to which the INDI Clients may connect.

Usually a INDI Driver will extend the class INDIDriver and will add as many INDIProperty as needed.

Please check laazotea.indi.driver.examples.INDIElTiempoDriver, for a simple example on the use of the library.

If you want to use it with the standard not I4J indiserver application you will have tu use a shell wrapper. A example one may be a launch.sh file with the following contents:

#!/bin/bash
java -cp ./dist/I4JDriver.jar laazotea.indi.driver.INDIDriverRunner laazotea.indi.driver.examples.INDIElTiempoDriver

And the command to launch it would be:

> indiserver ./launch.sh
See Also:
INDIDriver, INDIElTiempoDriver
